title: Bug 6009 - New class wizard doesn't get context right for nested classes
OB: When using the new class wizard in build 20011106, the context for nested classes is not correctly determined. Specifically, when a .java file is open in the editor and the user clicks the new class button, the 'Enclosing Type' field is blank.
EB: The 'Enclosing Type' field in the new class wizard should default to the current type in the editor.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open a .java file in the editor.
2. Click the new class button.
3. Check the 'Enclosing Type' field in the new class wizard; it should be blank (instead of defaulting to the current type in the editor).
